Package gamelogic

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gamelogic.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The game manager is responsible for the initialization and evolution of the game state at each frame using the rules defined by the user. It also centralizes the game data storage, like the list of surfaces, the list of species, the terrain, the species-rule connections and the networks. Its changes can be monitered by other objects using change listeners.
    See Also:
    Rule, Terrain, Network, Species, Entity, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameManager​(int width, int height)
      Class constructor, creates an empty game with no species, rule or terrain.
